channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: UK police release names of the 2 victims of the Manchester synagogue attack
item.description: Greater Manchester Police named Adrian Daulby, 53, and Melvin Cravitz, 66 as the victims of Thursday's attack. Three more remain hospitalized in serio...

item.title: Sarah Mullally Is Named as First Female Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: Sarah Mullally, the bishop of London, will lead the Church of England. She has been a vocal supporter of the rights of women in the church.

item.title: Manchester Synagogue Attack Fuels Fears of Antisemitism in Britain
item.description: In the hours after an attack, a blanket of fear and grief fell over synagogues and Jewish community centers across the country.

item.title: Even a government shutdown can't stop the quiz. Can you score 11?
item.description: This week's quiz also features bears.

item.title: Sarah Mullally named first woman Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: Sarah Mullally has been named as the new Archbishop of Canterbury, becoming the first woman to be chosen to lead the world's 85 million Anglicans.

item.title: 2 Victims Named After Manchester Synagogue Terrorist Attack
item.description: The police said Adrian Daulby, 53, and Melvin Cravitz, 66, were killed Thursday outside the Heaton Park Congregation synagogue in northwestern England...

item.title: The Jobs Report That Wasn’t Leaves Economists Guessing
item.description: Policymakers will enter uncharted territory without employment data that the government is expected to withhold because of its shutdown.

item.title: A public broadcaster's path after losing U.S. funds: Youth sports and less local news
item.description: South Dakota Public Broadcasting says there's an ironic result to President Trump's successful attack on public media: It will have to rely more on NP...

item.title: What to know about former U.K. leader Tony Blair, tapped by Trump for postwar Gaza role
item.description: As Britain's prime minister, Tony Blair succeeded in negotiating peace in Northern Ireland in 1998. Five years later, he joined the U.S.-led invasion ...

item.title: What to Know About Japan’s Leadership Election
item.description: Japan’s beleaguered governing party will convene for a crucial election that could pave the way for the first female prime minister or the youngest le...

item.title: Manchester Synagogue Attack Fuels Fears of Antisemitism in Britain
item.description: In the hours after an attack, a blanket of fear and grief fell over synagogues and Jewish community centers across the country.

item.title: ‘Czech Trump’ Andrej Babis Is Poised to Return as Prime Minister in Elections
item.description: The party of Andrej Babis, former leader of the Czech government, is expected to prevail in parliamentary elections that begin Friday.

item.title: Sarah Mullally Is Named as First Female Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: Sarah Mullally, the bishop of London, will lead the Church of England. She has been a vocal supporter of the rights of women in the church.

item.title: Late Night Sums Up Day 2 of the Shutdown
item.description: “No one has any idea how long it will last,” Jimmy Fallon said. “People are calling it the ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ of government shutdowns.”
